text: The Baynes Mountains are a mountain range in Namibia. ==Description== The Baynes Mountains form an escarpment plateau in Kunene Region in northwest Namibia, near the border with Angola (formed here by the Kunene River). The mountains range in altitude from . The Baynes are of quartz sandstone and have steep cliffs and gorges. The Baynes Gorge is where the Kunene River passes the Zebra and Baynes Mountains before entering the Namib Desert. Annual rainfall in the Baynes is about . ==Flora== Baynes Mountains flora include Abrus kaokoensis, Baynesia lophophora and Euphorbia ohiva. ==References== Category:Mountain ranges of Namibia
title: Baynes Mountains
